body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteers,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Frankfort, Septr 14 1863.
Genl L. Thomas.
Adjt Genl U. S. A.
Washington D. C.
Sir,

I have the honor to request that one First & one second Lieutenant may be added to the 3rd Battery Kentucky Artillery commanded by Capt. Neville. This Battery has just been recruited and was mustered into the U. S service on the 11" instant
By General Order No 110 the above Officers may be added at the Presidents discretion.
I trust that the additional Officers will be allowed this Battery.

By order of the Governor
John Boyle
Adjt Genl Ky Vols

K. 5.48. (V.S) ,1863
Frankfort.
Sept. 14. 1863.
Kentucky- State of
John Boyle.
Adj't. Genl,
Requests that on 1st and 2d Lt. may be added to the 3d Btty Ky. Arty.
Recd (A. G. O) Sept 19/63

War dept A. G. O.
Septr 19. 1863
Respectfully returned If the the Battery has been recruited to the maximum the additional Officers allow'd by G. O. 110 will be permitted.

By order of the Secretary of War
Thomas M Vincent
Asst. Adjt. Genl
